message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with the problem of imitation learning in partially observable Markov decision processes (POMDPs) using belief representations. This involves modeling the distribution over latent states in a POMDP using recurrent neural networks and probabilistic latent variable models. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), which deals with the development of algorithms and models for learning from data. 

The paper also involves the use of generative adversarial imitation learning, which falls under the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which deals with the development of intelligent agents that can perform tasks that typically require human-level intelligence. 

The locomotion tasks used for evaluation involve controlling robots, which falls under the sub-category cs.RO (Robotics), which deals with the design, construction, and operation of robots. 

The paper also involves the use of deep learning techniques for modeling belief representations, which falls under the sub-category cs.SY (Systems and Control), which deals with the development of control systems using mathematical models and algorithms. 

Finally, the paper involves the use of computer vision techniques for evaluating the performance of the approach, which falls under the sub-category cs.CV (Computer Vision), which deals with the development of algorithms and models for analyzing and understanding visual data.
